poem:
Title: The Call to Vote 

On London's fogged streets, young voices whisper,
Their tongues hesitating, forever in tenure.
In democracy's hall, echoes Khan's decree,
Stir, stir, wake! To fight the repeat of history.
A chilling morn, like Congress autumn, or Brexit's winter,
Do not let silence be your surrender. 
Fear not the ballot, for therein lies power,
Stand tall. Make this the golden hour.
